title: Which is dis logo...............?
content:
Can anyone tell me which logo is this or where i can get more clear image of this logo

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080220041028im_/http:/typophile.com/files/15399-London%20RC123_4298.gif)

 [‹ FFMeta: the first comission for an identity typeface?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080220041028/http:/typophile.com/node/42200 "Go to previous forum topic") [Obama's branding - what do typophiles think? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080220041028/http:/typophile.com/node/42054 "Go to next forum topic")
author: artslons

comments.content:
Looks like the heraldic shield of a British town. (Just an educated guess.)

. . .  
Bert Vanderveen BNO
Reminds me of the shield on Canadian Red Ensigns, still used in several provincial flags.

Not sure what it is in its entirety. However...

Top left is [City of London](http://web.archive.org/web/20080220041028/http:/www.ngw.nl/int/gbr/l/london.htm)

Bottom left is similar (although upside down!) to [Essex](http://web.archive.org/web/20080220041028/http:/www.ngw.nl/int/gbr/e/essex.htm)

Bottom right is [City of Westminster](http://web.archive.org/web/20080220041028/http:/www.ngw.nl/int/gbr/w/westmins.htm)

So I think its pretty safe to say it’s something to do with London.

it’s weird, for me, to call this a logo, almost insulting.

some care in naming things wouldn’t hurt.

when you see SPQR at the bottom of each roman inscription, do you name it an “efficient branding”?

dr

David

My dictionary says of logo, _“a trademark, company emblem or similar device”_

So it’s an heraldic shield (technically an escutcheon). I knew what artslons meant and this place is all about efficient communication. Sometimes that’s offensive.

Not everyone’s first language is English. Should we ignore posts for bad definitions/nomenclature/grammar/syntax? I don’t think so.

Yes ’SPQR’ is pretty ’efficient branding’ isn’t it. ’Gladiator’ had it tattooed on his arm and I thought, rightly or wrongly, “that is great branding”.

Come back if you find out where the logo/escutcheon is from. I’d quite like to know.

The filename contains “15399-London”. I don’t know if it’s related, but Google throws up the address of the Healthcare Commission, LON 15399, London, EC1B 1QW. So perhaps it relates in some way to an address…

Happy hunting.

Top right could be a strangely drawn [Norwich City Council](http://web.archive.org/web/20080220041028/http:/www.civicheraldry.co.uk/norfolk.html#norfolk%20cc) (towards the bottom) after all, Essex appears to have been rotated through 180°
